data.title: Checkin app
data.subtitle: A one-stop appetizer for all food-lovers out there!
data.description: Checkin presents all the services of a restaurant at the customer's fingertips. Stand out from the chaos and save one's valuable time, by enjoying the experience, and leave all the engagement touch points with the restaurant to this app.
work: Collaborated with the android team to build the Android app and implemented MVVM architecture to have a well-written decoupled codebase.
Migrated the android code from Java to Kotlin to deflate the codebase by 25%.

data.title: VLC for Android
data.subtitle: “Tests are stories we tell the next generation of programmers on a project.”
data.description: The project aims to contribute to the stability of Android port of VLC, by writing test suites for the VLC android codebase. This will ensure that the regressions are caught by developers at an early stage and the released application stays stable.
work: Wrote test suites in Kotlin for the VLC Android codebase.
Decoupled the existing codebase, using Abstract Factory Manager design pattern, to run unit tests without the native android SDK or native VLC libraries.
Wrote instrumentation tests for the application’s interface to ensure the correct behaviours of UI views.
Stubbed the integral components of codebase and wrote mocks for external dependencies to various System under Test.
Integrated my unit tests with the Gitlab CI/CD pipeline.

data.title: GDrive FileSystem
data.subtitle: A remote filesystem to mount with Google Drive.
data.description: FUSE is a system interface provided in Unix-like OSes to provide a clean API for non-privileged users develop their own filesystems without writing kernel code. This project is a Python script which uses FUSE API to mount an authenticated google drive on the running shell.
work: Implemented Google Auth and used Google Drive API reference for file stats.
Implemented in-memory cache using hashing of the path and corresponding custom file object.

data.title: Power Gestures for Linux touchpads
data.subtitle: Actions gestures on your touchpad using libinput
data.description: This tool is designed exclusively for power-users, hence the name 'Power Gestures'. It gives the end-user total control of how a particular chain of events - mouse, keyboard or trackpad gestures - be detected to trigger desired chain of actions via Linux commands.
work: Added Pointer and trigger keys when detecting gestures.
Added ability to add custom gestures for individual applications.
Added feature to specify multiple commands to run on successful gesture detection.

data.title: Auto-generate release notes
data.subtitle: Automating release notes and updating the remote
data.description: The bash script would automatically judge the correct release notes to use, by reading through the CHANGELOG file and considering the current tagged version in git. It'll then push an update to the GitHub repo, by posting a new release with this note.
work: Wrote a bash utility script to auto-generate release notes for a git repo, based on the latest commit tags and CHANGELOG text.
Uses releases endpoint of Github API to push the obtained notes to the configured repository.

data.title: DRF Problems
data.subtitle: How the heck should I be explaining errors?
data.description: The library implements RFC 7807 in our favourite Django REST Framework! Or, in layman terms, it introduces “Problem Details” in the HTTP APIs.
work: Maintainer of a python library which brings standard to APIs, according to the proposed RFC 7807 standard from IETF.
Wrote a technical introduction on it at The Startup Publications.

data.title: The Lost Origins
data.subtitle: “If a train station is where a train stops, what happens at a work station?”
data.description: This project aims to develop a MMORPG web game using RPG Maker MV engine and Django ASGI for the backend server. It supports real-time player interactions, group chat and cloud save. It was part of my Information Technology Workshop - II project.
work: Implemented real-time bidirectional communication between the game client and the web server with the help of websockets technology.
Developed RPG Maker MV plugins in Javascript to support online payloads for the existing single-player setup.
Used Redis-backend Django Channels on top of ASGI interface to support fast, asynchronous data-exchange on long-living websocket connections.

data.title: Codefest'19 webapp
data.subtitle: Technical head for building the brand new website
data.description: Codefest is a annual departmental fest of our Computer Science branch. This year, for Codefest'19, we made a Vue.js-powered PWA with matrix theme.
work: Collaborated with the frontend team to build a PWA for the Codefest website.
Implemented State Management pattern using Vuex.
Build a web terminal from scratch, with the help of Promises.

data.title: shivanshs9's Blog
data.subtitle: “My whole life is... Unlimited Code Works!”
data.description: A personal blogging webapp, where I can jot down my technical ideas and thoughts. It also happens to showcase many of my past projects, so I never lose track of what I haven't done yet. :D
work: Used gatsby's starter project by Calpa Liu.
Wrote GraphQL queries to fetch YAML data for this projects page.
Implemented various React components, like skill-o-meter.

data.title: Checkin API
data.subtitle: Django-powered REST API for Checkin app
data.description: It's a client-independent API to power the functionality of android app. The schema is defined with OpenAPI specifications.
work: Worked primarily on developing a RESTful API on the Django backend.
Deployed the backend on Kubernetes cluster and used Ingress as a reverse proxy. I centralized both the production and staging web services into a single entrypoint, using the Ingress.
Incorporated semantic versioning to the API by the creative use of Makefile and git commands.

data.title: VM Migration for Green Cloud Computing
data.description: To accomodate the high energy consumption of cloud data centres, a meta-heuristic algorithmic approach is implemented for dynamic Virtual Machines consolidations in live environment. Ant Colony Optimization algorithm is used for this purpose.
work: Implemented Ant Colony Optimization algorithm for optimal VM migrations and wrote simulation in Cloudsim Plus.
Benchmarked the algorithm on the open data, provided by NAS Systems division at NASA Ames Research Center in 1993, and compared it with 4 other heuristic approaches.

data.title: Training & Placement Portal
data.subtitle: Web Developer at a website powering placements of thousands of students.
data.description: TPO facilitates the process of placement of students passing out from the Institute besides collaborating with leading organizations and institutes in setting up of internship and training program of students.
work: Developed automatic Resume builder feature, which is used by hundreds of students.
Maintainer of website, fixing various bugs and improved admin control.
